name: COMPASS Adolescent Residential Treatment Program
description: Adolescent residential treatment program specializing in substance use disorders, dual diagnosis, and behavioral health for male adolescents. Part of Cumberland River Behavioral Health, offering comprehensive residential inpatient treatment with evidence-based therapies including CBT, DBT, trauma counseling, and family therapy.
source: Verified from AllTreatment.com directory and multiple treatment center listings
notes: State-funded addiction treatment agency. Smoking not allowed. Accepts male adolescents only. Offers comprehensive assessment, individual/group/family counseling, peer support, and discharge planning.
capacity: Adolescent males with substance use disorders
cost_information: Medicaid, Medicare, private insurance, sliding fee scale, cash pay
eligibility: Male adolescents with substance use disorders
